name: Creeper World 3: Arc Eternal
description: Creeper World 3 is what happens when cellular automata takes over a strategy simulation. Instead of discrete units that attack your base, a fluid-like substance spreads over the terraformable terrain. Your base, your weapons, your strategy... you must adapt them all.
minimum_requirements: 最低配置: 操作系统: Windows XP 处理器: Single Core 2 GHz 内存: 1 GB RAM 图形: Shader Model 2.0 or better DirectX 版本: 9.0c 存储空间: 需要 500 MB 可用空间
recommended_requirements: 推荐配置: 操作系统: Windows 7 or later 处理器: Dual Core 2Ghz 内存: 4 GB RAM DirectX 版本: 9.0c 存储空间: 需要 1 GB 可用空间

reviews.review_text: I think Creeper World 3 catches a lot of people off guard because of the cheap price, low resolution graphics and understated appeal. It also gets called a Tower Defense game a lot, which does the unique strategic components a horrible injustice. Instead, Arc Eternal is a laid-back thinking mans' RTS with unprecedented play-more value and excels as a game you can sink some time into in the form of a well thought out and strictly controlled approach, or as a casual attack on a map every now and then. It's like Civilization V in the respect that you'll launch it for a quick 20 minute game and find yourself embroiled in the relentless depths of an alien planet fighting to make a foothold on a section of map on the 4th planet of your 3rd star system 6 hours later, wondering where the time went.  The amount of content in here is staggering, and the campaign provides such a good learning curve and introduction to the new structures and some possible strategies that can't be praised enough. There's also an engaging backstory in the main campaigns which help you feel isolated and alone while fighting the uncaring, unforgiving creep, and while the dialogue is cliche at times, it helps bolster the already engaging gameplay and add a little depth.   Highlights
Not tower defense, more like power management while defending land. Very casual except for the timed missions. My type of game, but not for everyone.

This is a very fun game. It gives you hours of fun with high replayablity. There are several user created levels and a nice comunity surounding the game. This game adds a lot to the series with more arial units and more enimies and super units or titans. If you like strategy games espically tower defence like you will proabbly like this game. The series has been one of my favorites for a long time and this game keeps it in the favorite list. highly recomend it.

A true indie gem. The tags say this is a tower defense game, but it is really it's own thing. I suppose tower defense is the closest thing to what it is but it is a bit misleading.  So what it is? The premise is you have to fight back the creeper, which behaves pretty much like water pouring out of a spout (or more than one most of the time). It slowly spreads from it's source, and is stopped by walls and higher ground until it fills up the area below and reaches the correct height. To fight this, you build cannons, mortors, flying craft, anti-creeper producers (your beneficial creeper than cancels out the other creeper) and a few other weapons. These are your 'towers' but they are all mobile and can be placed anywhere they fit. To support them you need to produce energy, which comes from nodes that cover the ground and reactors. The nodes link up to others and need to link back to your base to produce energy and supply your troops. Reactors don't need any ground to cover and produce more. Troops out of supply will soon use up there reserves and will no longer be able to use their abilities.  So for gameplay you will slowly spread out over the map, extenting your network and fighting back the creeper until you reach the sources and take them out with special weapons. That's the basics but there is more. There is a scripting language for the maps that lets them bend the rules. There is one, non-story level where you control a man through a maze who shoots and finds keys for instance. To top it all off, there are literally thousands of maps (most likely, I didn't count). The main story is only a very small part of the game. After completing parts of it other areas open up, which are basically user created maps, beta testing maps and challenging maps. If you like the game enough you could spend thousands of hours on it, I'm sure. I was content with just the main story and a few other maps though.  If this looks at all interesting to you, do yourself a favor and pick it up. It isn't even expensive.
A game you can play 30m before work. Or sink 20 hours into at work. 10/10 would work again.

I found this gem in a bundle that I had purchased. It's a mix between an endless tower defense and a real time strategy game. a purple ooze gradually expands and you have to defend against it and attack it, slowly expanding and growing your base.   I did feel like eventually I found a strategy that would work against most maps. Defend as large an area as you can, and then slowly but surely break through and take what you need. Part of the challenge comes in defeating the maps as quickly as possible, but if you take it slow, you'll eventually be able to beat any map which isn't time based.

A fantastic game! Very fun and addictive, with an original idea. And if you beat the main missions? There are more! Tons of missions by the developers and by other players!   My only complaint is that the soundtrack lacks a good number of songs, but it is good music and really not a huge deal.

This game is a little bit different tower defence. You don't meet waves of a enemy, but fight against a endless pool of goo (creeper) with guns and try shut the goo spring. (creeper emiter in game). The enemy has no AI but use gravity against you. In fact, gravity with good map design makes game hard but simple if your base is lowest level of map and creeper masses are coming from uper hill, you get my drill.   The game has prequels made by flash on the internet so feel free and try   Pros - addictive - no ♥♥♥♥♥♥ AI - nice map design - good music and SFX  Neutral - story (solid and good but nothing spesial)  Cons - repetitive - too similar with flash versions
Haven't had this much fun in a while!

I'm not a big RTS player, but I found myself playing this for hours, upon hours - straight. This game doesn't look like much, but it delivers an interesting twist with the gameplay that I haven't found in many RTS games. EXTREMELY ADDICTIVE, you have been warned!  I'd say it plays like a slower style RTS like Supreme Commander, mixed with tower defence. However, there is a strong online competetive speed running intention behind this game. Best of both worlds kind of thing I guess. You can make and share your own maps. Play and complete on other people maps. I love how little download wait time there is between trying new maps. Literally, a few seconds.  The down sides, I'm not a huge fan of the artwork. I find it corny and unpleasnt looking. Nonetheless, it works somehow in this setting. There is also a lack of diversity, variation, and depth, with the units and enemies. Each unit has it's strict purpose like in a tower defence game. The outcome can become rather predictable and static. But don't let that stop you from trying this game! It's really fun.
This is one of those games that I been playing for a long time. And the fact it's on Steam now means I can easily get you hooked on it as well!
A great twist on the tower defense genre.

Fired up the game to see what it was like...  Seven. Hours. Later.  Love how you can do the missions at your own pace - either go for the frenetic chance at a best time, or settle back and setup for a long siege. Or try for the first and merge into the second when you screw it up.

This game is one of the most unique games i have ever payed. I have been in the creeper world since the beginning, and i was very excited when i noticed a version was coming out for steam. the mechanics of the creeper are unlike any opposing force you will encounter in any game. It is easy to learn btu difficult to perfect, you are always learning new strategies and it is highly addictive to play. Highly recommended.
Ignore the rough UI and basic graphics - this is a really solid strategy game and I enjoyed it immensely.

I really really like this game. I bought it during a sale for .74 because why not.  Played the first hour and the story is really boring but the gameplay is quite fun actually.  Played a few more hours and gameplay got complex after a while. New towers and enemys get introduced.  After a while maps get certain gimmics that keep the gameplay fresh and interesting.  After i was done with the campaign i discoverd the user made maps.   Its really good. Maybe not 15 bucks good but good.

I shouldve listened to karsten's advice i shouldnt of got this game... I bought not so long ago and now I have to abandon all my games cause of this. ITs so addicting and nothing like any other strategy game. I didnt think the story line may not seem very intresting but it once i bought it, I realized it has a very rich and mysterious story line.
Why am I discovering this game so late ?? Thanks Steam to be too be so closed to indies !  This game is very addictive, just try the demo ! (available on the official website)

What a game.  I wasn't familiar with the previous titles in the series, but this is absolutely great. Admittedly the game isn't really pretty and might put some people off, but gameplay-wise this is a gem.  I mean... how many games do you know where the main mechanics are attrition, network building and logistics?  At the start of the game I completely disregarded the story, but I quickly found myself wanting to know more... and the story is actually well-written and interesting! Which, I have to say, was a surprise (the game would have been as good without any story whatsoever).  Also, the pacing is great... every level holds a new mechanic, a new unit or a new obstacle to overcome.  The content is also monstrously gigantic, with custom maps, challenges, etc.  Now, not everything is perfect... the instructions on how to play are way too vague and the lack of tooltips coupled with odd terminology makes it a bit hard to get into. The UI is functional but could have been better. Also, people who might panic when there's too much much stuff going on might not like it...  Despite all of this, it's still a fantastic experience and real surprise... especially considering that nowadays games tend to fail to hold my interest for more than a couple of hours.  I'll be keeping an eye on knucklecracker's future endeavours.
Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys a good strategy game.

Creeper World 3 is an absolutely brilliant game of logistics and equilibrium, where the goal is to fight a sea of fluid. Everything comes down to building networks of weapons, shields, and other devices to slowly push forward against the rising tide. Full map terraforming, a wide variety of weapons and upgrades, movable towers, artillery, shields, and aircraft are all tools at your disposal. The story campaign has a wide and clever variety of mission types and goals, and an interesting 'big idea' sci-fi story line reminiscent of Arther C. Clarke is the icing on the cake here. The random mission generator, huge variety of additional non-story missions, and sizable community map selection ensure you'll never run out of new challenges. A generally slow pace, as well as full pause-and-issue functionality, ensures that you can play as methodically as you like. Fair warning, there is one timed mission in the campaign (Farbor), but after a replay or two you'll be able to beat the 35 minute timer without too much difficulty. Being smart is always vastly more important than being fast in this game.  Any fan of strategy, especially logistics-heavy strategy, would do well to check this one out. Highly recommended.
One hell of a lot of customizing, modding, action and strategy for a very low price/hr :)

Creeper World 3 is quite a unique game, it feels like a tower defense game mixed with real-time-strategy elements.  Like in most other RTS games, you have to build a base, though here it is more like a 'power grid', which is essential to power all your defensive and offensive structures. The main difference here though, is the enemy. Instead of tanks, humans or monsters, you have a lava like liquid, that slowly creeps its way to your base and tries to 'fill' the entire map.  It's called 'The Creeper'. I know, it sounds like the name of a cheap 60s horror movie, but it's not.  Anyways, most of the time you'll build turrets, mortars, jet fighters and bombers to defend yourself from The Creeper. But usually that's not enough. You also have the option to 'terraform' the environment. That way you can either dig trenches, or, which is a lot more effective, raise the terrain to wall off your base.  The whole process is quite a lot of fun, especially when you unlock things like the Bertha, which is a giant cannon, or the Thor, which is a giant spaceship with multiple turrets that rains death from above.  The thing I like the most about Creeper World 3 is that you can play whatever way you like. This might be the slow and defensive way, or the fast and offensive way. This is quite important if you care about getting in the top 10 list of each map. These lists are primarily sorted by how much time it took you to complete the map, though to be honest, you'll have a hard time beating the best times, since they're usually around 20 to 30 seconds for each map. This is especially frustrating because I doubt those times are legit most of the time.  All in all though, Creeper World 3 features a huge amount of content, which is good if you like getting your money worth. It's also bad if you want to 100% this game, because judging by the amount of levels, it might take you hundreds of hours to do so.  There's also the fact that you can make your own maps, and play other players maps right inside the game. This gives Creper World 3 almost infinitive content, though some player created levels might be too easy, or even impossible to beat.  Conclusion: Amazing game with an enormous amount of re-playability, easily worth the full price if you're a fan of tower-defense/RTS type of games.

Currently working my way through the campaign and can say it is horribly addictive once you begin building up your arsenal. The game eases you into what soon becomes a challenging mix of resource gathering and holding back the endless creeper threat.  Well worth a buy and you will sink hours into it!

Hello, guys!  I really can't even how good this game is. I've played CW2 before, so I didn't hesitate to buy this game as soon as I've noticed it.  What is CW all about? It's an interesting strategy, where you don't fight against enemy units similar to yours, but massive amounts of creeping blue goo. So it feels a little bit like tower defence, but really innovative one.  The in-game economy system is quite simmilar to one from Supreme Commander (which I loved too!) and it's based more on flow of the resources than stockpiling them. This approach forces costant action, which is nice.  So, does concept still feels to You boring? Fear not, as so far every single map is quite diverse and suprises me with something new (I've completed about 30% of game, and CW2 which was quite brilliant too!). Your enemy sometimes spawns various units too, and the goo doesn't always act like it's expected to.   The game has its own plot, which is not that plain. There are no cosmic civilisations fighting against each other. There's no war, humanity lost against creeper long ago. You've been asleep for 5 billion years. All you can do is crawling through ruins of ceased race of humans, and try to make sense of what happened. Why do I even mention history in such simple game? Honestly, because at this point I am simply curious how will this story end.  The only 2 downsides I've noticed are: -crappy, plain graphics. I don't think it matters though, as this simpleness comes in one package with perfect gameplay and practical interface. -lack of multiplayer. Seriously, guys, I don't care, add it somehow!  What do I say at the end? Mabye I'll describe my general feel about it. This game feels like the best flash game ever, but with large campagin and saving and stuff. Buy it. Do it. I don't think anyone would regret doing it, except if it makes him fail his exams or sth.

Creeper World is a tower defense with very unique gameplay and design. Unlike most tower defense games your enemy isn't a horde of monsters, but is instead a steadily expanding mass known as 'creeper'. Defeating the creeper isn't as simple as having strong towers - you have to know how to hold back the creeper while expanding your own area of influence, taking into account the the creeper will ooze in from multiple angles and will build up in areas of low elevation to eventually climb up onto higher ground.   Your own building mechanics are quite interesting as well. Instead of having independent towers, you instead build a web-like network of resource gatherers, utility structures, and attacking towers. Managing this web can get quite tricky at times, because all resources must flow through a command center and take time to traverse the network. Done incorrectly you could end up building a tower but not being able to arm it in time to defend against the creeper.   Also, while the creeper acts as a steadily growing mass, the player often ends up mirroring the creeper in many ways. Collectors - the primary resource generator - are most effective when spread out, forcing the player to expand their area of influence if they want more resources to spend. There are also many resource deposits around the map which must be contested, forcing the player to expand their area of influence even more. Aiding this playstyle is the fact that attacking towers can be respositioned, allowing you to leapfrog towers to slowly but steadily push the creeper back.  Overall the game is an excellent example of a unique twist on a genre and very polished gameplay. It's an extremely satisfying game to play and I highly recommend it to anyone who finds the concept interesting. Don't worry about not playing the previous games - they give more of the story, but this game is fully functional as a standalone experience.

This game has a thrilling story with a presentation that I absolutely love in strategy games, and it reminds me in this of one of my favorite RTS games, the first StarCraft. The gradual tech and story progression with each - sometimes long, sometimes difficult - mission, adapting to and overcoming the new challenge, is just very enjoyable for me.   Now that I finished the campaign, though, I feel I have only scratched the game's surface. With all the user-created maps, and extra map packs the game provides, I am already returning for more challenges.  A criticism I'm reading in the negative reviews is how the game is the same grind all over again. Building up basic macro and defenses, and then progressing with micro as you upgrade your tech. For a game where every map is different, leaving a wide array of viable strategies and tactics to the player, I find this a very bad point. The SupCom-esque resource system, the focus on map control and relentless assault make this game very interesting, and even the initial 'always repeated' steps come in a personal flavor and depend on the map.   The graphics may look abstract and weird in the screenshots, but they quickly make sense when playing the game. The terrain layers are also very consistent. And honestly, I found a salvo of Bertha shots' dispersed Creeper very satisfying to watch. There's few things like it.  If you're interested, watch some gameplay videos or just wait for a decent sale. I got it at -90% so sales do get decent! There's little room for disappointment at that price, and maybe it will cause you yourself to write a positive review in time.
a great rts, aspecially if u love murdering liquids.

Creeper World 3 is a fun and innovative take on the strategy/tower defense genre. Your main enemy is an ancient, liquid based entity that spreads throughout the universe, destroying all in its path. In order to kill the Creeper, you must build an energy network, build turrets to push it back, then destroy its source.   There are a wide variety of tools at your disposal, various types of turrets, shields, terraforming devices, attack craft, and even the ability to manufacture your own creeper, to name a few. This creates considerable depth, by giving you the choice how to tackle the various missions.  On the subject of missions, there are a lot of them. In addition to a main campaign (which does a good job of introducing players to the nuances of the game and the many units), there are several other sectors, numerous community made maps, and a dial a map function which allows for map generation. In short, there's a lot of hours fun to be had.   In addition to great gamplay, the visuals are nice, and there's some really great music to play along to. I've encountered no bugs in my time playing. This is a game I would unconditionally recommend to strategy & tower defense fans. Even if strategy isn't normally your thing, CW3 is quite different from the usual fare, and you may well find something here to your liking. Well worth checking out!

I'm not going to describe the game in detail for countless others have already done that. I'm only going to say that this a good game and if the offical trailer etc. has sparked any interest, look up some gameplay footage on YouTube and make your final desicion.
fun and addictive game. Best and a quite unique tower defense game along with offensive strategy. Just simply a fun game.

A satisfying game, where the enemy is totally predictable (it is literally as dumb as thick goo), yet no less challenging for that.   The eponymous 'Creeper' is a thick sludge that spews out of emitters in the game world, and you must force it back. The creeper isn't smart, it doesn't think, and it doesn't even have anything in the way of AI. What it has instead, is a pleasingly viscous fluid simulation. It flows downhill, it pools in low areas, and it can't cross high terrain without building up behind it and overflowing it like a dam. This is the key to the game. Work out where the creeper will flow, and divert or destroy it to survive and achieve your objectives.  The game is one of thoughtful management. Rarely is there urgency, except during scripted missions, or if you seriously mess up and end up watching a purple tidal wave swamp your low-lying energy collectors. That's okay! The challenge is one of incremental advancement and the satisfying conquest of areas that were drowned under a layer of creeper 8 stacks high.   I'm a little concerned with balance issues (there is one early-acquired unit which seems overpowered, especially in groups) but I'm content to tend my garden of creeper without abusing it, which is an unusual state of affairs.

Simple game, really. The only difference in levels are the levels themselves; using the same tatics will get you through most of the game. Yes it is repetitive and yes it isn't graphically next gen, but it is incredibly addictive. If you wish to pass the time and have some money to throw around (or get it at $5 during a sale) then I recommend this game.
That's a very good game if you like that kind of gameplay
Awesome game, hours of entertainment.
An indie stratergy gem.  If you can handle games that don't feature high poly content and love stratergy, this is a must buy.

It's been a while since I played this one, but saw this on sale and got shivers... yeah nothing beats blasting away unimaginable amouns of goo out of existence using cannons capable of dismantling a planet.  Price is right, looks are simple, gameplay is solid and goo is sticky - 9 elevation levels out of 10.
A very cool take on the tower defense genre. The campaign almost plays like a puzzle game, and the story fits pretty well. This is a well developed game!

This game's pretty interesting. It's kind of a tower defense, but it's so much different than your average tower defense. It takes a unique spin on it. You place down a main station and place collecters around and then you have to connect cannons to those. But rather than just placing down towers and having them work immediately, they need to first be built and have to be connected to the main station by wires. Then there's also the enemies. 'enemies'. By enemies of course I mean evil water called the Creeper. It gradually spreads around and you use the cannons to push it back (this is as far as ive gotten in the game, there's more enemies and towers later on). Overall the game is really good. It tries something new for a tower defense and does it really well. While I do prefer the standard kind of tower defense, Creeper World 3's unique take on them is really fun and brings more to the genre, and it's cheaper than it deserves to be. I highly recommend you atleast try the game.

Well this review is for my badge status such n such, but I picked a game that is indeed epic, and everyone should play. Yes this game is basically a flash game, but of all the crappy little flash games, I would pay 10X what I paid for this. This game is amazing.
It's a really fun and very addictive game...i highly recommend this game

I remember playing the first Creeper World when it was just a flash game, good times. But huge huge improvments. This game is all I can ask for from the dev of this game. The art is well done, controls, sounds, alot of stuff. Not to forget to menton that there is 100s of hours of content for this game like story, level editor, free mode, all sorts of game modes! I did not think twice buying this.  My rating overall is 9.5, why -5? Multiplayer would be cool, but I kinda understand how hard it would be, but still perfect singleplayer gameplay is enough. If you like RTS and a hard stragity based game, this might be just for you! (Later in the game it gets insane almost) Phew that map   Farbor   you will never forget about it, I almost gave up and it was only like level 10 out of   ..50..   or something! And that's not even going to be the ending you can play unlimited of custom maps that people made and such! The community is awesome to.  If you get this game get ready to be addicted for awhile, I suddenly got out of orbit of the addiction somehow.   NOTE! : If you are thinking of getting this game but you don't know then go to Knuckle Cracker looking for Creeper World Evermore (it's free) if you don't like that very much you might wanna keep your money in your wallet. (But there is a shiz ton more features in this one, A TON'LDSKJH!

It may not look like much from the screenshots, but this is a great game. Plenty of challenge, lots of thinking. Plenty of pressure not to screw it up. Grab the demo, then buy it if you like what you see. It's a worthy game. Just quit playing it well before you need to sleep unless you want to lie in bed thinking of ways to beat a particularly nasty map rather than sleeping.
Very addictive and with the colonial space (user generated content ) years of fun
So different and so much fun!
So different and so much fun!

An endless battle against a deceptively simple, yet overwhelming, enemy.   Even if you somehow manage to clear all of the pre-built levels this game comes with, there's always the random level generator and the online sharing tool to play with.
very fun and very unique game that I always come always come back to play
I played it for a bit and it's simply addicting.
I'm so hooked on this game, and have been bombing through many of the player-made maps as well!
'Mortars, Baby'

The best combination of Tower Defense, Real-time strategy and Resource management. Unique and fast-paced gameplay along with stunning storyline.  This game is already one of my all time favorite <3  Graphics yet simple but fun. for $3 with so much content, it's a no brainer for any TD, RTS gamer.  worth every single penny :)  10/10 Ultimately recommended

I've just finished the main campaign.  Pros:    Varied missions that keep the formula fresh    Multiple approaches to some missions    Mostly good interface.    Plenty of side missions still to do.   Cons:    No ingame help as to what the different constructables do and only a one time introduction to them.    Sometimes the solution to a mission is a bit obscure.
It will steal all of your sleep.

I played this game for a few hours - not a huge amount of time, so it may get better farther along, but it wasn't particularly engaging. The games initially seem to be spending some time stabilizing the creeper - at that point, you've basically won, but pushing forward to complete the objectives takes a decent amount of time and is just tedious.

I used to play this ditty on Kongregate! KnuckleCracker still knows how to impress.  You've watched the gameplay, you get the concept - you're fighting a blob; storyline irrelevent. Figure out where to land your HQ and lay out some power infrastructure. Get to the point you can build two power structures at once, build a few sets of two. Construct a laser and mortar, click 'stop resupply' and when they're built - figure out which one you need first - click 'disarm' and then 'resupply' and then do the same for the second weapon. Construct a third weapon, your choice, I prefer mortars over lasers 4/1 so I'd make two mortars.  The trick with mortars and your power supply is, they recharge faster than they fire. So you can pinch off their supply, use it to construct and power other buildings, and stop them - then resupply the mortars more quickly than over-loading your entire power supply would. By playing 'half-court' with the power supply, I have been able to greatly improve my speed. Some levels that I've thought were impossible, I've re-visited and been able to beat; some are still impossible.  Some cheats must exist because of high scores. High scores mean nothing though. You play, you win and lose, you have fun, you get frustrated, you leave, you come back and figure out a new layout or move on. It's a good game. I play it often - I mute the music and watch TV on an adjacent screen though. Too much of the music will kill your brain like bathsalts.

Took me 20 hours to complete the campaign and its 20ish levels. Now i have access to the other game modes and oh god there are thousands of levels there send help.   This game deserves your love, and this dev deserves your money.
Best Tower Defend-ish Strategy game ever. But there is a significant fps drop when using 30+ guppies or 100~ Bombers.

This game fills the hole in my heart left by Command $ Conquer 4. It's fun, challenging, and has a nigh infinite amount of variables to keep it fresh and interesting, including a random level generator and tens of thousands of player-made levels. The writing in the story campaign is awful, but thankfully you don't need to know any of it and it's all skippable. There are also free demo versions of the game you can find on steam or the internet, so try those out before you buy.

This is the worst game ever in that you play it and then A WHOLE DAY passes and you're like CRAP I WAS SUPPOSED TO BE A PRODUCTIVE HUMAN BEING AND DO THINGS and then you shrug and be like all right one more map I guess.
Fun for a while
Amazingly creative indie game. If you're not averse to low quality graphics as long as the gameplay and music are great, then check this out.
Wow, this game is fantastic!
It`s all about strategy

Really neat game, has a decent story. Unique take on tower defense, you're basically fighting a creeping liquid type monster. I got about halfway through it and lost interest, the graphics were a little to non-AAA for me I think -- but that's just me. It was a good value and maybe I'll go back to it someday.
Just buy it!

I love tower and defense type games especially the ones with high complexity. For all of Creeper World's unique building types, interesting building connections, and neat other ideas -- you're still fighting water. The story tries to turn the 'purple water' into a menacing all encompassing alien blob, but it doesn't behave like one. Heck, the water moves in a really non-aggressive way like waves lapping at the shore. If you want a game with AI that adpats to your playstyle, look elsewhere.  The most stressful time in any given match is the first few minutes when you're building your base up. I've hit restart numerous times because of acting too slow (mostly since I'm watching TV at the same time); however, once you're up and running defeating creeper is not really about strategy or skills, it's more like a waiting game. You'll be slowly grinding out the time of waiting for buildings to construct or moving your buildings around. The only way this game is interesting is that it allows speed players to post their completion times for everyone to see.  While I do fawn over pixel art, Creeper World is very dated even for pixel graphics. There are loads more mobile games that look better than this. I will say that the strongest aspect of the aesthetic is the soundtrack. I never felt bored with the music and it gives this emergency type of rock background in the environment. Nontheless I turned it off so I could watch TV and youtube.

The games play out basically the same way every round.  There isnt any AI to speak of. The enemy is a mindless blob of watery goo.   It was fun at first but quickly became a grind. It just couldnt hold me.

If you want it, you've already got it, beat it and got the T-Shirt  For those of you currently unsure of Knuckle Cracker's newest escapade: A resounding 'meh'.  I absolutely suck balls at RTS's, not sure why, I just do. While there is some innovation in Arc Eternal (as with all formulaic games like it), it's mostly the same as before, both a blessing and a curse.  While the gameplay is fine, it's how it plays that I don't like. Arc Eternal is constant grindfest through the levels, all the same. Get collectors, build turrets, stabilize, then branch out. It's a slow, slow game out there, and that's going to make it or break it for you. While others may relish in it, I can't. Everything is so painfully slow and repetitive, after the initial hour or so of 'Yes! New creeper world!', it became possibly my worst gaming experience, after possibly the end of HL2: Episode 2 and Deus Ex: Human Revolution.  For extra salt in the wound, if you overextend by a ♥♥♥♥ing millimeter, the game cuts your ♥♥♥♥ing hand off, your last 30 mins of work explodes in purple creeper, and I almost screamed with rage. For that price tag? No way, just go play one of the free ones online or something.
Fun for an hour, then its just boring, not challenging at all

i don't recomed this because it has no skill and twice every level you get an achievement sure it's hard but in the same way 1000 addition problems are hard it takes a half hour to inch your way around, over all i'd say its worth oh $2.50 or so... don't get me wrong i love tower defense games and the idea of water as the bad guy was neat but it was poorly done. i know its hard to make a game and all but i'm saying is that somewhere it went wrong and no one caught it.

This is a gem of a strategy game. It's a RTS Tower defense-esque game, this might not sound like a good idea, but it works beautifully. There are two main mechanics that I will address:  1. The Creeper. This is your enemy, it's a liquid entity that creeps forward from spawners, slowly covering more and more of the stage. You need to build towers to fight it back, and in turn advance farther along the stage yourself. Creeper would be very difficult to deal with if it didn't obey the laws of physics. Basically, in order for creeper to overflow onto a higher level of terrain, it has to have nowhere else to go on its current level. This leads to some fairly interesting placements, like a very powerful spawner at the bottom of a deep crater. There are plenty of other enemies too, runners and digitalis namely. Runners just run along digitalis and need to be destroyed with sniper towers, they can't directly destroy your towers, but can stun them long enough for creeper to overflow onto them. Digitalis is a kind of grid-like enemy that conducts creeper and prevents towers from being built, trust me, it's more difficult than it sounds.  2. The Network. This game has parallels to a tower defense game, but calling it one doesn't do it justice. The biggest conventional differences being: Towers are networked, they have to be connected to your base to function; Towers can be moved freely, even off the network, albeit with limited ammo; towers use energy, constantly.  The biggest difference as I stated is the network. You have to build collectors and relays between towers to provide pathways for the 'packets' of which there are three types, ammo, construction, and totem. This means you can't just build towers in the most strategic spots right away, you have to build out to them, often fighting tooth and nail to get to them. Additionally, these packets cost energy, which is distributed evenly between the active types of packets, energy is obtained through collectors, which collect energy across an area, and reactors. Collectors gain no benefit from overlapping area and should be spread out, they are also one of the main staples in your network of towers. If you get too ambitious with your expansion, you'll enter energy starvation, where packets are produced less efficiently and you run the risk of your blasters running out of ammo and the line being pushed back.  Between the campaign mode and the hundreds of other levels in the game + fan made ones, you could get hundreds of hours out of this game (I didn't because I just played creeper world 1 and 2 before it and was done after the campaign). Having played all three games, this is the best.   Even at full price, I think you'll get your money's worth, this is a difficult game, you will need to think strategically and act quickly. It's a refreshing change of pace from most RTS and tower defense games in my opinion.
Fun. Buy the game.

This game is listed as Tower Defense game, but its less about defense and more about pushing a wave back to its source.  Essentially your enemy isn't a monster, a beast, a beam of light... its water (this game calls it creep) and in order to stop creep from extending you have to push it back and turn off the faucet. Your enemy has no path, it goes from high to low, and can be channeled like a river or as even as a ocean.  Is it the best defense game you've never heard of... ITS NOT A DEFENSE GAME ITS AN ASSAULT GAME. Your not fighting to stay alive... your fighting to stop the expansion of your opponent any means necesary.  Story is ok... its deep and enriching but if you want to ignore it you probably will. Gameplay is complicated, yet simple... just watch out for Farbor, if your a slow player you will not finish farbor Music is repetitive and generic... its like 4 tracks on autoplay. The sounds are meh Replayability? Do you like to play for time, play lots of maps, creator is very deep...

Whether you play games in short bursts or long hours, this game can be played either way. Def worth the money! The only thing that would make it better is multiplayer. Not sure how that could be done, but I'd pay double to see it 10/10

This is the best fluid simulator you'll ever lose to. (Seriously, it's a great game. If you're not sure, you can try some of the previous iterations out over on kongregate and the like to get a feel for the gameplay. Quite unique, and a lot of fun. And just like Civ, it'll have you up half the night trying just one more level..)
This is the best flash RTS I have ever played in my entire life.
I love this game; it has a nice artstyle and many community maps to keep the content comeing!

Fantastic game. Has a real zen quality to it since the pacing is so much different from other tower defense games. The level design is fantastic, and consistently challenging in new ways. Also the story is like something out of a Stephen Baxter novel. I only wish there were more levels.
Amazing, got sucked in from the start, played 15 hours in 2 days. Reccomended for people who like strategy games!
This is a great game. The story is kind of weak, but the game itself is great fun.

Your awesome, I'm awesome, this game is AWESOME. Go ahead, think you shouldn't buy this game. But seriously, this game will end all things that aren't awesome. Awesome+awesome(awesome)=Too much Awesome.

Bought this during the summer sale and only meant to install it and play it briefly to check it out before sleep. Nearly an hour later, after many attempts to improve my time on the first objective, I had to commit myself to closing it after 'one last try...'

I really love this game. I played and bought the previous two, which are very similar but also very different. Oxymoron? Yep. These are essentially tower defence games with interesting mechanics.  You must kill the creep, a gooey purple 'stuff' that seems to obliterate anything in its path. The creep spreads through the map and you must build towers and setup your economy in a race against time. In the first game you cant destroy the sources of the creep, but as the great story progresses you finally find technology that allows you to take the fight back to the faceless enemy.
floods have come... let's shoot!!! prepare our biggest mortar and cannon...!!!! This is great solution to solve our flooding problem.....

The first time i played this as a flash game I was confused because i couldn't understand how the game worked originally as everything was too fast.  As i grasped how to play it. The game series became very enjoyable. The game is about preventing the water (Creeper) from reaching your base using turrets while trying to think about logistics and placements.  The game gets harder and harder, while being still as enjoyable.  Instead of looking at the review have a go for the flash game first before thinking of purchasing it :P
A very interesting and fun take on the tower-defence genre, where you gfight against a liquid enemy.

Extremely fun game. It hits the mix between casual and intensely hectic game play. Easy to understand, the first few levels are fairly quick and easy but the further you go the more you will have to think things through...or just load a bunch of mortars. Also it is good to know that you can relocate weapons to the front line rather than continuously building forward. Overall a solid little game well worth the price.
great tower offense/defense!

Fun tower defense/offense game where you try to stabilize against a liquid enemy with layers of depth. Then, you push them back enough to destroy their spawners. Can't beat the price during the summer sale: $1.50!

This game captures a much larger amount of strategy than most tower defenses. You can play defensively and hold off the creeper until you build a large enough power supply to overwhelm it, or you can go on the offensive and try to lock the creeper in a choke point. With all the different kinds of units you can build, there are lots of ways to go about either one, and each map calls for a different approach.  10/10

This game is absolute perfection. I've played Creeper World 1 & 2. I wasn't exactly sure what to expect coming into this, and I was a little sketchy paying a few bucks for it.   I am so glad I did. This game is worth every penny. You think you will sit down for a few minutes to beat a mission, and it'll end up being 6 hours long. But it's not the kind of 'OH GOD MAKE IT END', it's the kind of 'Wow, I wish I could experience that again.' The beginning missions start out easy, and the difficulty curve steadily increases, until you will be punished for turtling, or not being offensive enough. It is a beautifully crafted game which you absolutely have to try.   It comes with ridiculous amounts of content, endless replayability, and hours of fun. It is truly a 10/10 game. I cannot recommend this enough.
Havent been so positevely surprised with a game for a loooong time! GREAT GAME!
Way more fun than I thought it would be. Kinda like tower defense, but it's like a mix of that and RTS in that you need to push back an ever-spreading force until you can destroy its source.
Holy cow, what a sleeper. Paid a few bucks for this game on the summer sale and it took over my weekend. Tons of fun. Simple premise that gets very deep.  I had a blast playing it. So will you. :)

I used to play older Creeper games few years ago. This game feels even more amazing thank to the amazing soundtrack. I just love the soundtrack so far. Gameplay hasn't really chaged. It is worth the money

I loved the flash games and I love this game. If you have played Creeper World before and wanted more, get this, if you have not player Creeper World before but want to without buying tis game, browse the internets and look for the flash game version. It's the same concept and mechanics, just not as developed.
This game is sick, as much as previous (free) 2 games of Creeper World. It's sick. I cant stop play :) And I don't know how they did this, but this game is as playable as oldschool hits.

I don't like to write reviews but this game totally deserve it, cause i haven't play a RTS this good since Starcraft I. Excellent story, specially if your a sci-fi fan, and excellent gameplay, each level feel very different.   This game is a gem.

Pros: -More interesting storyline than Arkham Knight -Better gameplay than Arkham Knight -More upgrades than Arkham Knight -More challenging than Arkham Knight -More satisfying combat than Arkham Knight -Potentially more game hours than Arkham Knight -Cheaper than Arkham Knight -Less crashes than Arkham Knight -Will take you time away from Arkham Knight    Cons: -Worse graphics than Arkham Knight -Will take you time away from Arkham Knight   If this game is on sale, you got to try it out.   Ps. Little disappointed with Arkham Knight while writing this
Best RTS game I've ever played.
22 hours to complete the story arc. Well worth the $15. Also a good ending to the trilogy.
I almost wish they would bring 1 and 2 to steam. I wouldn't mind paying a few bucks to have all 3 in one spot to play whenever I want. Great game overall

PROS: + fun relaxing gameplay + story is really engaging + hundrers of maps after finishing the main story + doing things your way. There is a few different ways to approach the problems and most of them will work. All videos I watched solved the maps in a different way I did. This is satisfying  CONS: - story is text-based. It could use some voice acting - graphics are very simple and not really descriptive. Units feel like random shapes  NOT PROS/CONS: +- most of the maps play the same way. You have to set a perimeter using your resources the best you can and then kill the creeper back. Once you set your perimeter you have a guaranteed win. Its just a matter of patience. The game play is what gets this game such high score reviews, so im not sure this is a bad thing per se. I also had to restart a few maps a few times during the first part... so it makes you think a different approach at least a little :)

A simple battle of attrition. I do wish that Creeper expands faster as each mission goes on, but the story is suprisingly engaging and there's a real challenge in trying to speed run the missions. There is also plenty of content to enjoy, and plenty of varied units, each with their own pros and cons. Missions are as easy or hard as you want to make it. The music is very fitting and fantastic. The graphics are simple and adequate. Pick it up if you're a fan of tower defense games and games similar to that genre.

I love this game! It has the right amount of challenge as a variety of ways to win. Theres so many ways to tackle each map. You need to decide where you base goes, decide which node goes first, decide if you want to go for the risky quick kill, or the slow but steady. Every map I play I feel like I know the perfect strategy going in, only to later change up my game.
really ♥♥♥♥in awesome!
Great strategy game. Lets you solve puzzles freely from easy to difficult while against the clock.
Very unique and fun game. 100% Recommended.
This game will consume you
Never played a game like it. Although I got through most of the game turtling, still awesome fun. A++

Creeper World 3 is an entirely unique real-time strategy game. It has a wide variety of units and enemy abilities. Each world feels unique with carefully designed challenges to overcome. The game steadily and intelligently ramps up, introducing new units and enemy tactics and abilities as you work through a huge campaign of worlds. It's a difficult game to put down. There are a massive amount of well-designed levels.

The game is exactly as shown in the video trailer above. It's true that there are two playstyles: stalling for energy and speedrunning each map; but i think the two of them are valid and you can have fun playing the way you prefer. The game's content is nearly infinite so you'll be able to play all the time you want, althought the game mechanics are practically the same throughout the end-game. So my advice is that if you are not sure to buy it even after watching the game trailer and reading the reviews you can go and play the other games of creeper world to see if this game fits for you. I'm 99% sure that you will love it!
Nice and slow paced strategy.  Warning! Eats entire afternoons.

Creeper World 3 is a game I picked up on sale just to finish off the Christmas purchase for a card. Since buying this game it has close to 80 hours of play time and never leaves my system.  I am finished the story mode but there are so many other missions to play and download. Love this game.
A Clever mix of RTS and Tower Defence, you can have battles of attrition or mini strike forces. You can do so many things.
Highly recommended for any fan of RTS or tower defense. Check out his older versions (Creeper World: Evermore) on  Kongregate.com  if you want to see how the game works before you buy.

I have played Creeper for 3 hours now. I am not a hack and slash guy. I for example very much enjoyed Defense Grid. Still play it today. If you liked Defense Grid, I would expect you will enjoy Creeper World III. This will give you something engaging to do while you wait for Defense Grid 2 to be released. I also would expect because of the explosion of map possibilities, this might become a mainstay of one of those games you come back to for a distraction from those other games that are not entertaining you at present. Enjoy, I know | am.  Update, I have now played it for 31 hours, and it is surpassing all expectations.
Tower defence? Check. OCD? Check. Support indie games? Check.
This game is really fun. The graphics are pretty basic but still appealing. I recommend it to anyone who likes tower defense.
Great game, good tower defense hybrid, nice resource system and good strategy

Only if you are serving a life sentence in prison will you have enough time to play this game. I once use to do things with my life... Now I have this game. And all of my time goes to the game. If you value your time don't get this game. On the other hand, if you wish to grow old and not notice... This game is for you!
Great time waster of a strategy game!

The beautiful successor to Creep World 1, that being CW2 was much different. This game is an RTS pseudo-tower defense game in which you battle pure entropy in liquid form. The creeper is a seeping goo spawned forth from emitters as a tidal wave sort of attack, which has killing countless civilizations before you. The gameplay consists of placing down your command node and building web-networks of energy collecters, ore mines, mortars and blaster turrets that you then use to advance on the creeper, slowly pushing it back and keeping it at bay while you build a nullifier to destroy the emmiter producing it. It's challenging and addictive 11/10

a very successfull addictive game that should be in your collection if you like strategy games. in my opinion this game is one of the legends of its kind.  you can simply call it a tower defense, but it extends your experiance with its uniqe defence/offence style.  you try to defend yourself from unstopping evil organic fluid that flows all around the map in a very nice storyline. after finishing it, you challenge player/beta tester or developer made maps.  i have just finished the storyline and writing this with its excitement. i believe i will play this game for many more hours. even i will try the stroy line again and again with different strategies.  if yu like to play as a turtle this game will satisfy your needs if you like to race against time, this game offers you this also if you are an agressive strategist, you will find many interesting opportunities here.  i strongly suggest this game if you both like tower defence and rts. watch some youtube videos about the game and decide
OH SWEET JESUS ITS EVERYWHERE! ITS CLIMBING UP THE WALLS KILL IT KILL IT WITH FIRE 10/10 WOULD KILL LIQUID AGAIN

Spent a surprising amount of hours playing this. Always liked a good stragedy game and this is no exception. Completed the story and now im attempting to go through the sectors. Finding the sectors have alot of challenging levels to sink your teeth into. Keep your energy flowing and the creeper dying...
I've played the original flash games before and I can genuinely say this game is leaps and bounds better than its predecessors. Great job!

It's simplicity is its strength. Plays a lot like a defense style game, that eventually pushes you on the offense. And if the amount of maps they packed into the shipped game wasn't enough for you (Seriously, it's a lot), they offer a map maker so you can create your own challenges.

This game is awesome!! There is a Campaign, which has a story you probably only understand if you have played the previus games, but the story is just basicly a big tutorial introducing you step by step to every unit and taktik. the graphics are bad for today but it just doesnt matter because you wont have the time looking att the landscape because after the campaign there are hundreds of levels to beat and only a few are easy , also usergenerated content. I wont say anything on how this game works because you should see it in the trailers and gameplays etc.   A little note: You can beat nearly every Level in ca.20 minutes, but only if you are realy good. Most of the time it takes 45-100 minutes to beat a single level, so you will need some time.
Experience is worth $5. More of a relaxing game. 3 hours in and none of the missions have had a squeeze.

TL;DR Endlessly unique yet simple RTS/Tower Defense  I highly recommend this game to people who enjoy Tower Defense and RTS games but don't like to get too complex. There's a very limmited number of towers, both yours and the enemies, so it is pretty easy to pick up. It might seem that it would get boring quick since the enemie is just a creeping mass of goo, but all the levels in the campaigns are different and the user created content is simply amazing.  The only bad thing about this game is that some missions seem impossible, but it just takes a little bit of thinking to figure out the trick to beat it.   9/10
Great game, story was cool too.  This game has a pretty high replay-ability, so its deffinitaly worth the money.
Is Awesome time waster! Buy Now!
This is a fantastic game for those who enjoy planning and incremental building.
Very interesting game concept. It can still become repetitive if you like to take your time on each level :)
One of my favorite RTS games of all time. I can either rush or turtle to my hearts content.

You build guns.  You fight a fluid.  It's RTS + Tower Defense + Logistics + Fluid Dynamics.  And it actually has a cool and interesting story.   I was skeptical but bought it on sale. Would have been happy to pay full price. Easily 40+ hours worth of playtime. I'm a few hours in and am still learning how to play.

This game has what most strategy games should have: a simple concept that you can conquer in many different ways, but not so simple that you become bored. You always know what your objective is, but how you conquer it is where creativity manifests itself. It's also really cool to be fighting a literal ocean of enemies. 9/10

This game is fun XD I recommand it to anyone it does look complicated at first but its very simple i saw 1 video not even a tut just a Gameplay off whats what and it was easy as F*ck. I just started playing it 2 days ago and I cant stop XD
Creeper world is not a very creepy game.

This game is suprisingly awesome. I was expecting mediocre, but got a great mix of RTS and Tower Defense genres. I am still working through the campaign/story, and afterwards there are thousands of maps to play on in sandbox mode.  You can move weapon towers. Click them and they can fly to another location. Keeps you from stranding stuff that is out of range of the action and save resources.
Great game!
'I'll be quick this time'  5h and 5000 nodes later - 'What am I doing with my life?'
Creeper world 3 is both fun AND addicting, I seriously recommend this game to ANY tower defense/strategy lover.
Better than an ant farm!
Great game with addictive gameplay

This game is okay.  It has the following problems:   Once you've got your creeper-murdering system running on a map, the rest of the map turns into a slog where you slowly advance through the stuff.   Anti-creeper and shield sort of merge badly. Shields pushes out or destroys your anti-creeper.   Some of the graphics are weird. One of the buildings has a rotating tower with static shading that rotates when that building starts rotating.   You can assume that everything else is a-okay. Get it on a sale maybe?
addictive and high replayability

I enjoy playing this game inbetween league queues. Its like a mix between an RTS and a Tower Defense game. Hard to explain. Anyway heres the breakdown:  Pros: - Lots of Replayability - Challenging - Main campaign takes a long time to beat - Really addicting once you get the hang of things.  Cons: - Challenging? - Takes many attempts at that start, because there isn't a decent tutorial. - The story is pretty negligible.

If you are a fan of the series, I don't think this will disappoint you. You have a great campaign that I feel tells a great story, not only that but it allows you to pick up and play a randomly generated mission and challenges.   If you are new to Creeper World, pick it up cheap in the sales, still worth it.   10/10 Would creep again.
I cannot suggest this game Highly enough. The cinematics are a bit cheesy, and the mission selection UI a bit clunky, but the actual gameplay is absolutely fantastic.

One of the most captivating games a have ever played!  Gripping story line with a twist. Simple, yet intriguing game-play with different strategies possible to win the game. You fight against 'creeping' enemies and time, yet the game is quite relaxing and can be played for a few minutes during spare time. But good luck with trying to stop playing.
If you played the series, you will enjoy it without a doubt. The sweet taste of strategy combined with puzzle gaming. Unique, simple, oddly satisfying.

As always, Knuckle Cracker knocks one out of the park. The Creeper World series gets better and better! The game has very simple rules, but combining all the various building types and enemy types creates a chaotic situation that will make even veterans carefully consider every new level. And there will always be new levels thanks to community-made levels and a built-in random level generator.
Creative, dynamic and very fun. I really appreciated it !
It is funny.. but i don't know why
A tower defense game like no other. An incredible timesink.

Well nothings Much Left for me to said since Store already told Most of the games play and it's unique mekanism So I'll say that this games was a series games .Means it have a 'Story line'. Before Creeper World 3 :Arc Eternal Launch in stream it have be started for as far as I know.  story so far . . .  As a Web games In story of your ascendant that have to fight[still the games play was focus on flee-surviving] with a really limited tech [many of the tech was presented on older version like the core unit collecter] with out knowing what they are really fighting to.So with a really limited knowlage about they enermy names 'creeper'they stand no chance on fight[As reveal some point on games that not only your ascendant but nearly all civilization was also effected]. So In creeper world 2 redemption one of the main hero manage to find a way to destory the 'creeper spawner' Know as 'spawner' and the discovered of the anti creeper.with Both technology they manage to fight back the creeper. BUT Still the creeper does evolve and did really somehow overwhelm and whip out the humanity again. So the rest is your to discover.
The best RTS game i have played since ... well, ever.

If you like to turtle and build massive bases in Real-Time Strategy games, then Creeper World 3 is the game for you. Gameplay consists of slowly advancing your line of towers, inch-by-inch, as you attempt to hold back the (literal) enemy wave. It may get a bit dull eventually since the enemy does not build-up more advanced tech within a single level (although they do over the course of the campaign). I've found that it's great to have open in another window while listening to music or a livestream.
What can I say? I keep coming back to this one, again and again. Great replayability.

I just love this game so much, it fills in the gaps and holes other games left in me by being incomplete or bad. Creeper World 3 is a base building tower defense with deep strategy and extra mechanics to keep things interesting.  You, the player, Vs. The creeper - A growing, organic, hive fluid that spreads across terrain consumning all in it's path.  Cannons, mortars, snipers, big berthas and more!!  Are all at your disposal to keep back, and annhilate the creeper and it's tools!!  Every mission is different, every map is unique, and there are thousands if not millions of player created maps in addition to the tutorial, campaign, and different sectors.   If you enjoy tower defense, a bit of micromanagement, strategy, an adaptive enemy, and so much content that you'll be happy for weeks, hell, even if you enjoy factorio, you'll probably enjoy this game just as much as me. It's what I searched for in a game for a very long time, and now that I have it, I am playing it as much as I can, and loving every second.   10/10

If the idea of high res eye candy is a requirement for you, do not get this game. However if gameplay and mechanics are important, (like they are for me,) this is a great strategy game.  The campaign will take you a few days to get through (depending on how much time you devote to it each day.) However, there is so much content available through additional 'official' scenarios and fan made maps (there is an editor) that you will not have time to ever look at all of them, let alone play them all. (and most that I have played are quite good.)  Right now, the spiritual successor, Particle Fleet: Emergence is also available on steam. While having similar concepts there are plenty of differences. I would suggest getting both. Both games are very good in their own right, if you like one, you will like the other... and different enough to justify having both.
